page.title: 16MEOLE BRACE CHURCH
page.content: {Meole Brace Church}is a Victorian Church made of red sandstone that was finished being built in l867. It has a square tower which has a gold painted weather cock. The tower is about 3O metres high. There is wire netting around every window. There are four doors and on one of the doors there are some nice patterns. It was built by a man called{E. Haycock.}There are four gargoyles, one on each corner of the tower. On the main part of the church there are three crosses. Nearly all of the stained windows are the work of{William Morris}and{Burne Jones . The windows are very famous and they show pictures of{Jesus}on the cross and surounded by angels, and also pictures of martyrs such as{St.Stephen and{St. Nicholas,}and of Old Testament stories such as{Noah.}They are said to be among the best ever designed.
